oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of Chattanooga Junior League as Red Cross Volunteers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The Junior League ladies of Chattanooga served as Red Cross Volunteers in the Red Cross Canteen throughout WW I. Red Cross Canteens provided refreshments and meals for servicemen who were unable to get adquate meals while being transported to camps or embarkation centers. The Canteens were usually near railroad depots or ports. Chattanooga, a railorad transporation hub, saw hundreds of soldiers, sailors, and marines pass through. This photograph shows the ARC Canteen in front of a railroad car stop.
